ygData.subject: Re: A question on kill stealing.
ygData.msgSnippet: 1)  If you chased him down and did the most damage, you should take the loot 2)  the party that does the most damage gets the xp and the loot, doesn t matter
ygData.messageBody:
1) If you chased him down and did the most damage, you should take the loot
2) the party that does the most damage gets the xp and the loot, doesn't matter who gets the killing blow.
3) Depending on my mood, I would have either told him to F off, or just ignored him and continued my hunting. Kill stealing is a legitimate problem in the game, but it seems to me that there are a lot of people just itching to say HEY, YOU STOLE MY KILL....dunno why, but thats what it seems like to me. A prime example happened to me last night, we were in Cazic Thule, fighting a 34th or 35th lvl Zealot. After a long and hard fight, we killed it, then some guy comes running up to our party and says "hey ass holes, that was our zealot". A) never even saw this guy until the zealot was running, B) he was 25th lvl, no way in hell he could have even hurt the zealot. He hung around for a few minutes bitching about people who steal kills, while in groupsay we were all like "wtf is this guy talking about", ignored him and he eventually left.....ya see, the world is full of idiots....just like real life :)

Salr D'Taynkk
Dark Warrior of The Kith
Veeshan

>>> Kelly Pruett <pruett@...> 5.17.99 8:48:39 AM >>>
From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
1.) Was I ethically wrong to take the loot?
2.) Does the game only allow the majority damage dealer to take the
loot, or the final swinger?
3.) How would you guys deal with this situation?

Thanks for any advice ....
-Faderic of Qeynos (Ellorisi Marr server)
